RoyalTitleDef.label: initiate
RoyalTitleDef.description: This is the first tier that the League of Villains recognizes. At this rank, the pawn isn't recognized as a true villain yet, but they have a foot in the door.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 1 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 1 villains are barely worth noting by most organizations. These are often the generic troopers that the League uses as cannon fodder.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 2 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 2 villains are little better than Tier 1 in the League's eyes. Small gangs of Tier 1 villains may be lead by a Tier 2, but they have little to offer beyond that.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 3 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 3 villains have made enough of a name for themselves to receive support from the league to not just start small raids, but take part in raids against larger settlements. While they are still relegated to leading small squads, the League is beginning to take note of their achievements.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 4 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 4 villains have finally surpassed the small-time villain limitations. Now they aren't just some small gang to send on tasks, but a trusted ally that may be able to receive small gangs to them for support in battle.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 5 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 5 villains have firmly entrenched their position as a notable villain, and the League is willing to provide even more support to the villain's plans in hopes that a new high tier villain is in the making.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 6 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 6 villains are often recognized by the path of destruction they left behind them on their rise. Should they be so inclined, they can call on multiple of the League's orbital railguns at the same time, create a salvo of destruction that further consolidates their status as an agent of death.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 7 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: An individual often spends years of their life accruing enough infamy to reach this status, but now that they have reached it there is no question in anyone's mind. This is the first high rank of high tier villain, and the League often spares no expense supporting them.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 8 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Tier 8 villains often gain their status by leveling multiple settlements for resources. Many leaders become nervous when a tier 8 villain is nearby, and usually try to increase the number of soldier they have nearby to ward against invasion.

RoyalTitleDef.label: tier 9 villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: The highest tier a villain can be assigned, often limited to those commonly believed to be planetary threats. By this point entire armies may be raised to kill them, and the League of Villains allow the pawn to tap into the entire orbital network to use their strongest ability, Targeted Armageddon.

RoyalTitleDef.label: the super villain
RoyalTitleDef.description: Whether The Super Villain is still alive is up for debate, but should The Super Villain grace the League of Villains with his presence, he will become the unquestionable leader of the League, and all shall fear his name once more.
